title: ASD EL1 Information Security Technologist
description:
Total Salary Package - $113,648 - $177,500 (plus 15.4% super) 
  Brisbane CBD - QLD,Canberra - ACT,Melbourne CBD - VIC 
 
 The Role
  This vacancy is within ASD’s IT Security Section, which has core responsibility for oversight and support for safeguarding ASD’s most sensitive information across all IT systems through the implementation of the Information Security Manual’s four cyber security principles: Govern, Protect, Detect and Respond.  As an Information Security Technologist for IT Security’s Capability team, you will work with teams from across the organisation to ensure interoperability of systems so that a variety of security incidents and risks across all Defence Intelligence networks are appropriately detected, addressed, and reported on to enable the security of ASD’s IT systems and missions.
  About our Team
  ASD is entering an exciting phase of growth, innovation and transformation. Our agency has committed to delivering REDSPICE, which is the most significant single investment in the Australian Signals Directorate’s 75 years.
  Our Ideal Candidate
  The Australian Signals Directorate (ASD) is looking for EL1 Information Security specialists to lead its Capability, Security Operations Centre, Advice and Assistance, Continuous Assurance, and Incident Response teams. We are looking for applicants who have the ability to think critically and to communicate with both technical and non-technical audiences, and who are motivated to learn and develop their leadership skills.
  Successful applicants will be a team leader of systems engineers, security specialists, and/or incident responders (depending on vacant position and applicant skills), in support of maintaining the security and integrity of ASD systems and capabilities.
  
  The vacant Assistant Director positions include:
  
  1) Assistant Director Security Operations Centre
  2) Assistant Director Incident Response & Hunt
  3) Assistant Director Security Operations Centre
  4) Security Capability and Research
  5) Assistant Director Advice and Assurance
  6) Assistant Director Continuous Assurance
  
  The 
 Assistant Director Security Capability and Research position will manage and, provide governance oversight to a team of contractors and Commonwealth Officers to design, deliver, sustain and iterate on compute and networking environments built on current day technologies.
  
  The 
 Assistant Technical Director Security Capability and Research position will provide technical direction to a team of contractors and Commonwealth Officers to design, deliver, sustain and iterate on compute and networking environments built on current day technologies.
  
  The 
 Assistant Director Audit and Reporting position will manage a team responsible for detecting, deterring and mitigating security risks to the organisation. The role covers both the protective monitoring and tailored reporting functions.
  
  The 
 Assistant Director Incident Response & Hunt and Assistant Director 
 Security Operations Centre positions will manage a team responsible for protecting ASDs infrastructure and data from the latest security threats. The role will act as an escalation point for the team and co-ordinate Whole of Branch responses to information security incidents.
  
  The 
 Assistant Director Advice and Assessment position will manage a team responsible for assessing and authorising the organisations systems, providing organisational cyber risk advice, and providing security advice and communications to the organisation. They will also assist in developing and managing internal security policies and plans.
  
  The 
 Assistant Director Continuous Assurance position will manage a team responsible for assuring the ongoing security compliance of the organisations system. They will manage vulnerability reporting, Essential 8 reporting, asset discovery and numerous organisational uplift activities.

title: Specialist Data Engineer
description:
Specialist Data Engineer – Perth
 
   Diverse and challenging projects with our Knowledge, Innovation & Technology team
   Engineer and support complex systems to manage BIG data compute tasks
   Turning business use cases and requirements into technical solutions
   Utilise your hands-on coding skills in Python and/or R
   Work in a flexible work environment where we prioritise a healthy work/life balance
 
  About the Role
  Finding better ways to provide the materials the world needs. 
 We have an opportunity for a Specialist Data Engineer to work with challenging and exciting analytics problems and positively impact the business while engaging with a team of technology experts and data scientists. This role will involve gaining substantial experience working with our data systems to develop state-of-the-art data solutions for our business’s data problems. The Knowledge, Innovation & Technology team is courageous in the pursuit of innovation, curious in the development of emerging technologies and caring of our people and relationships. You will be regularly challenged but given the support to drive your innovations!
  Reporting to the Senior Data Engineer, you will support the Advanced Data Analytics team to design and continually improve services that solve business problems and provide insight to making improved decisions for our Iron Ore business. You will utilise your hands-on solid coding skills in Python, R and/ or Scala to
 
   Ensure best in class processes and techniques to develop and deploy data analytics solutions to the business
   Collect, aggregate, and analyse structured/unstructured data from multiple internal sources and provide patterns, insights, and trends to the business decision-maker
   Utilising the latest available technologies to flexibly manage and scale data pipelines and analytics models
   Developing platforms and processes that support the reproducibility of results
   Foster an innovative and “disruptive” technology culture to identify and drive value-creating opportunities
   Help the broader Rio Tinto Iron Ore function by advising technical complexity of identified opportunities
   Provide training and knowledge transfer to support the deployment and continuity of the analytics products developed
 
  This role will suit applicants residing in or willing to permanently relocate to Perth, Western Australia.
  About You  Ideally, you will have a postgraduate qualification in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Machine Learning, or a related field, combined with extensive experience as a data engineer in Machine learning projects, preferably using agile methodologies.
  You will also have experience with some or all of the below:
 
   Proficiency in exploring and manipulating large datasets through applications or programming interfaces.
   Demonstrated experience preparing data for Data Science and Machine Learning using heavy industry data sets (structured and unstructured)
   Ability to write and optimise SQL queries and create efficient data extract/transform/ load (ETL) programs and tasks
   Pipeline development, across different data architectures, (transactional, time series, streaming, unstructured) and storage solutions including use of APIs
   Cloud based solution design using containerisation and serverless architectures in AWS and/or Azure (Cloud Formation/ARM)
   Knowledge in Change control using Git and release pipeline experience using Azure DevOps
   Strong analytical and problem-solving skills to diagnose and logically resolve technical problems
   Agile delivery and project management
   Proficiency in SQL, Python/ R, Linux (Bash), Scala and Go (desirable)
   Software engineering experience desirable
   Knowledge and skills in one or more of the big data frameworks, i.e., Spark, Hive, Hadoop (desirable).
 
  Where you will be working
  This role is based in Perth, Western Australia, out of our Central Park office, working Monday to Friday, with ad hoc travel to sites in the Pilbara. We support and encourage flexible working arrangements.
  What we offer
  Be recognised for your contribution, your thinking and your hard work, and go home knowing you’ve helped the world progress.
 
   A work environment where safety is always the number one priority
   A permanent position working directly for Rio Tinto
   A competitive base salary reflective of your skills and experience with annual incentive program
   Comprehensive medical benefits including subsidised private health insurance for employees and immediate family
   Attractive share ownership plan
   Company provided insurance cover
   Extensive salary sacrifice & salary packaging options

   Exclusive employee discounts (banking, accommodation, cars, retail and more)

  About Rio Tinto
  Every idea, every innovation, every little thing the world calls ‘progress’ begins with a first step, and someone willing to take it: explorers, inventors, entrepreneurs. Pioneers. 
 For 150 years, Rio Tinto has been a company of pioneers – generations of people spanning the globe, all with the grit and vision to produce materials essential to human progress.
  Our iron ore has shaped skylines from Shanghai to Sydney. Our aluminium – the world’s first to be certified “responsible” – helps planes fly and makes cars lighter. Our copper helps wind turbines power cities and our boron helps feed the world, and explore the universe. Our diamonds help us celebrate the best parts of life.
  Every Voice Matters
  At Rio Tinto, we particularly welcome and encourage applications from Indigenous Peoples, women, the LGBTQIA2 community, mature workers, people with disabilities and people from different cultural backgrounds.
  We are committed to an inclusive environment where people feel comfortable to be themselves. We want our people to feel that all voices are heard, all cultures respected and that a variety of perspectives are not only welcome – they are essential to our success. We treat each other fairly and with dignity regardless of race, gender, nationality, ethnic origin, religion, age, sexual orientation or anything else that makes us different.
  Applications close on 28 April 2023 (Rio Tinto reserves the right to remove advertised roles prior to this date)

title: Data Engineer
location: Remote in Melbourne City Centre VIC+2 locations
description:
Your new company   A leading profit-to-members super fund based in Melbourne providing competitive and cost-effective superannuation services to members. Our client is looking for a Data Engineer to join their small team on a permanent basis to support the ongoing delivery of data transformation.   Your new role   Reporting to the Lead Data Engineer, you will play a key role in supporting the end-to-end design, development, delivery, and operation of solutions that enable trusted, consistent and timely information to the business.   You will be responsible for: 
 
  Providing data provisioning expertise in project support activities including aligning data warehouse and other development work, document implementation plans, review BRD's and business cases
   Undertake research and development on new data provisioning capabilities, functionality and emerging technologies as required,
   Produce the design and development of scalable and testable software using modular object-oriented principles, design patterns and practices
   Ensuring data warehouse data is correct and available through ongoing monitoring, troubleshooting, and remediation of issues
   Drive continuous improvement across data provisioning processes and technologies
   Maintain and manage documentation for ongoing data requirements including interface contracts, code versions, data lineage and rules and business requirements
   Liaise with internal and external stakeholders
 
  What you'll need to succeed   The successful candidate will have 3-5 years' experience in Data Engineering with experience in: 
 
  Demonstrated experience with ETL tools, MS BI stack, MS Azure, SQL Server (SSIS, SSRS, SSAS)
   Designing and developing with MOLAP/ROLAP/OLAP tools
   Designing and developing with reporting tools - Tableau/ PowerBI
   Demonstrated experience and knowledge in SDLC, Agile, Kimball and DevOps
   Experience working in the superannuation industry (preferred)
   Strong communication and stakeholder influence abilities
 
  What you'll get in return   You will be part of a fantastic small knit team in an organisation with excellent work culture. You will also get: 
 
  Permanent opportunity with great career perks
   Competitive salary up to $155k package
   Hybrid and flexible work arrangements 3 days WFH
 
  What you need to do now   If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV, or call us now.  If this job isn't quite right for you, but you are looking for a new position, please contact us for a confidential discussion on your career.

title: OFSAA Data Engineer
description:
Req ID: 29649 

Department: PRJPA - APS 117 + Australia (31920870) 

Division: Institutional (T45000) 

Location: Melbourne 
About the role 

 At ANZ our purpose is to shape a world where people and communities thrive. We’re making this happen by improving our customers’ financial wellbeing so they can achieve incredible things – be it buying their home, building a business or saving for things big or small. 

 As part of the APS117 project, the candidate will be responsible for the design, build and support of all the data transformation requirements to implement the changes necessary to ensure the Group OFSAA platform is ready to accommodate the APS117 framework. The candidate will join the existing development team and work closely with testers and OFSAA functional specialists. 

 Major Duties 

 
 
 Analyse requirements and identify solution options informed by existing design patterns, standards and the operational architecture. Work collaboratively with the Business, Functional SMEs and Data/System teams to agree on the best fit option. 
 Complete design and generate build artefacts using prescribed tools, techniques and processes ensuring compliance with all source code version control and deployment practices. 
 Ensure performance is built into the DNA of all code and runtime artefacts. 
 Complete unit testing and peer review of all code changes. 
 Supply documentation to inform set-up activities for testing (Systems Integration Testing and Quality Assurance Testing) and provide support during the testing phase actioning all assigned defects in accordance with the agreed priority. 
 Complete and support deployment activities for developed code as part of the broader change management process including second line support for changes introduced into Production post go live. 
 
Role Location: 833 Collins Street, Docklands VIC 3008 

Role Type: 12 month Fixed Term Contract, Full-time 

 What will you bring? 

 To grow and be successful in the role, you will ideally bring the following: 

 
 
 Proven track record developing batch driven PL/SQL code in a large scale Oracle data (11g, 12c) platform. 
 Excellent proficiency in PL/SQL design including the use of dynamic SQL supported by robust logging. 
 Hands on experience using Solaris, SQL Client tools such as TOAD or SQL Developer, source version control tools such as Bitbucket and scheduling tools such as Control-M. 
 Is a team player able to work independently with minimal supervision. 
 Knowledge of data modelling concepts typically found in Large scale data warehouse implementations. 
 Must have experience working with batch processing systems ingesting at least 200GB of source data per day against a base of 8TB+ using Oracle (11g, 12c). 
 Experience with Agile project delivery methodology. 
 Communication and inter-personal skills must be excellent. 
 Is outcome focused, adapts to change and employs a growth mindset. 
 So, why join us? 

 There’s something special about being part of ANZ. From the moment you join us, you’re part of a team working towards a common goal: improving the financial wellbeing and sustainability of our millions of customers. 

 But it’s not just our customers who’ll feel your impact. You’ll feel it too. Because at ANZ, you’ll have the resources and community you need to take the next big step in your career, towards even bigger things in the future. 

 We offer a range of benefits tailored to the countries in which we operate including Health and Wellbeing programs and flexible working arrangements. 

 You’ll also enjoy working in a diverse and inclusive workplace where the different backgrounds, perspectives and life experiences of our people are celebrated. We encourage you to talk to us about any adjustments you may require to our recruitment process or the role itself. If you are a candidate with a disability, let us know how we can provide you with additional support. 

 To find out more about working at ANZ or to view other opportunities visit www.careers.anz.com. You may apply for this role by visiting ANZ Careers and searching for reference number 29649 

 Job Posting End Date 

 04/05/2023, 11.59pm, (Melbourne Australia)

title: Software Engineer (Full Stack)
description:
Req ID: 32107 

Department: Data & Analytics (30330271) 

Division: Institutional (T45000) 

Location: Melbourne 
About the role 

 
Job Title: Software Engineer (Full Stack) 

Location: Melbourne 

 Do work that matters by solving problems that enable financial wellbeing 
Develop full-stack data-intensive cloud-based web application for our customers 
Join a progressive organisation with the people and policies you want 

 At ANZ our purpose is to shape a world where people and communities thrive and to achieve this, we need a talented Software Engineer to join our client integration solutions team within the Institutional Wholesale Digital. The team works with the Institutional Banks most valuable and sophisticated customers to design, develop, modify, document, and validate the most appropriate and fit for purpose business solutions using Integrated Services. 

 The role will be part of a hybrid team of Data Scientists and Software Engineers and will contribute directly to the delivery of the Institutional Data & Analytics product roadmap. This is the perfect role for an entry to mid-level Software Engineer who is excited to apply their technical skills to develop full-stack data-intensive web application on Google Cloud Platform. If you are passionate about building customer focused solutions using best practice approach, this role is for you. 

 What will your day look like 
Work with Data Scientists, Business Analysts and Product Owners to deliver data insight apps to customers 
Understand customers and and liaise with business stakeholders to workshop customer focused solutions 
Utilise tools and best practices to build, verify and deploy solutions in the most efficient ways 
Follow the best practices around reviews, security, quality assurance and documentation 
Follow continuous delivery practices to increase delivery speed 
Provide ongoing support for platforms as required i.e. incident and problem management 
Support delivery of key analytic initiatives 
Collaborate with other teams to explore new business initiatives 
What will you bring? 

 We know not everyone will bring all of the skills and experience, and at ANZ we are focused on people bringing a growth mindset to their approach to work. Some of the skills we are looking for are below, but don’t worry if you don’t have all of these as learning on the job is the way we work. But back to some of the skills: 

 Hands-on knowledge and experience with end-to-end data and software product delivery 
Ability to review codes developed by Software Engineers and Data Scientists in the team, and share knowledge with them 
Experience in building C# applications 
Excellent Git source control skills 
Demonstrated experience in frontend development (React) 
Creative technical problem solving and debugging skills 
Understanding of software development techniques such as Object-Oriented design, Test-Driven development, and Continuous Delivery 
Ability to adapt to the latest developments in software engineering 
Have the curiosity to learn about emerging technological techniques and innovations 
A team player with an enthusiastic can-do attitude, and willingness to help the squad to deliver 

 
Additional preferred skills:
 Have a talent for crafting easily understood explanation for various audiences 
Experience in Python 
Understanding of docker and Kubernetes 
Experience in one of the major cloud platforms 
Knowledge in monitoring and observability concepts and experience in related tools (e.g. Splunk, Dynatrace, etc.) 
So, why join us? 

 There’s something special about being part of ANZ. From the moment you join us, you’re part of a team working towards a common goal: improving the financial wellbeing and sustainability of our millions of customers. 

 But it’s not just our customers who will feel your impact. You’ll feel it too. Because at ANZ, you’ll have the resources and community you need to take the next big step in your career, towards even bigger things in the future. 

 We offer a range of benefits tailored to the countries in which we operate including Health and Wellbeing programs and flexible working arrangements. 

 You’ll also enjoy working in a diverse and inclusive workplace where the different backgrounds, perspectives and life experiences of our people are celebrated. title: Expressions of Interest- Data Engineer
description:
At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.
 
  The opportunity
 
  We are seeking experienced Data Engineers at all levels to join our EY Data and Analytics team in our Brisbane, Melbourne, Canberra and Sydney offices. This role is offered on a flexible, full-time basis.
  Due to the nature of the client, the successful candidate must be an Australian Citizen.
  EY DnA is the data and advanced analytics capability within EY Asia-Pacific, with over 600 specialist employees working across multiple industry sectors.
  We implement information-driven strategies and systems that help grow, optimize and protect client organizations.
  We go beyond strategy and provide end to end implementation of real-life data environments and have some of the best architects, project managers, business analysts, data scientists, big data engineers, developers and consultants in the region.
 
  Your key responsibilities:
 
 
   Develop, design and implement data and analytics solutions that are flexible and sustainable, make optimal use of technologies and ensure achievement of client outcomes and objectives.
   Manage end-to-end design activities that deliver self-service data and analytics solutions ensuring a user centred approach.
   Develop and maintain relationships with stakeholders to influence and achieve balanced outcomes, and to support automated deployment of solutions.
   Undertake research and analysis regarding the design, development, implementation and evaluation of technical data and analytics products and ensure delivery of quality solutions.
 
 
  Skills and attributes for success
 
 
   At least 3+ years’ experience in development with Python (preferably in AWS Cloud sphere)
   Experience with AWS Glue, Lambda, SQL, Spark and Redshift
   Previous experience working with data, data environments, databases, large data sets
   Knowledge and experience in end-to-end project delivery, either traditional SDLC or agile delivery methodologies (or hybrid approaches)
 
 
  Ideally, you’ll also have experience
 
 
   Engaging with both technical and non-technical stakeholders
   Consulting, including engaging directly with clients
   Ina delivery role on Business Intelligence, Data Warehousing, Big Data or analytics projects
 
 
  What we can offer you
 
 
   Explore how a career at EY is yours to build at www.ey.com/au/careerdevelopment
   Discover how, when and where you can work at www.ey.com/au/flexibility
   Learn about our commitment to DE&I at www.ey.com/au/diversity-inclusiveness
   Understand how our benefits can support you at www.ey.com/au/benefits
 
 
  Acknowledgement of Country
 
  EY acknowledges the Traditional Owners and Custodians of the lands on which EY offices are located around Australia. We pay our respects to their cultures, and to their Elders — past, present, and emerging. Find out more about our vision for reconciliation at www.ey.com/au/reconciliation
 
  Apply now… we’re over 9,000 perspectives in Australia and we’re ready to welcome yours.
  At EY we take inclusivity seriously, and we’re committed to removing barriers and improving the employment prospects of people with disability or long-term health conditions. We encourage you to share any support and adjustments you need to be your best and participate equitably in our recruitment process. We understand sharing your needs with us can be daunting, so if you have questions before or during your application, we welcome you to get in touch at contactrecruitment@au.ey.com or +61 3 8650 7788 (option 2). Anything you tell us will be kept completely confidential.
 
  EY | Building a better working world
 
  Our preferred applicant will be required to undertake employment screening by EY or our external third-party provider.

title: DATA ENGINEER
description:
An exceptional opportunity in a rapidly growing market 
  Industry-leading technology 
  Join an innovative team delivering real-time applications.
 
 
  The Role
  This position offers the applicant the opportunity to participate in real-time IOT applications for the mining, industrial production, and infrastructure markets. As a Data Engineer, you will work with customers, suppliers, and our technical staff to identify requirements, select technology and deliver solutions for integrated data applications.
  As a Senior Data Engineer, you will lead these applications and outcomes.
  The core element in our market is the need to combine both real-time and historical data with associated asset data and media to supply information for the personnel engaged in the actual process being monitored. We consolidate information from other systems including IT however mostly present information to the OT layer. These needs place a different emphasis on data gathering, access, and visualisation, and the successful applicant must have worked with data from these types of sources before.
  The company promotes flexibility in hours and WFH is an integral part of the work routine. The person will however need to be available to regularly attend our Illawarra-based office. The applicant should assume 60% of the time will be required in the physical office environment or on-site with customers. Out-of-area travel will be required for presentations, meetings, and commissioning.
 
  The Work
  Our customers will seek to retrieve information from the production network, both in raw form and based on processed data e.g. calculations and analytics, to support process and business improvements.
  We work with large volumes of low latency data, which in our industry can vary from milliseconds to typically 2 seconds old. The volume of data is already large and growing.
  We visualise the data using not only dashboards and reports but using Virtual Reality, Virtual Environments, and Augmented Reality.
  The key elements involved are:
  
   Identifying customer requirements 
  Specifying software and operational functionality 
  Selecting the process and software elements that will be used 
  Defining data and interface needs for the application 
  Delivering the solutions within a distributed team of expertise 
  Providing effective visualisation transforming data into knowledge
 
  The following web pages provide additional understanding of the work required.
 
   Real Time Process Intelligence
 
 
 
   Process Digital Twins
 
 
  The Employee
  Key elements and skills are:
  
   The person must be available to fulfill a full-time role as a company employee. 
  You need to have been directly involved in automation and control applications with at least 5 years of full-time experience on PLC or DCS platforms. 
  The role requires proven experience in data acquisition in these process and operational environments. 
  The role requires a clear understanding of the implementation of process historians including data structures and the application of their calculations and analytics. Experience with products such as OSI PI and iba suites of software would fit this criterion. 
  Significant experience in interfacing with other data storage methods. As a minimum practical and significant experience in the use of databases both to store and retrieve information. 
  Experience in the use of reporting products. Grafana is commonly used for reporting, however, this can vary based on the customer’s preference. 
  The skills to produce information in a form that is clearly understood are essential. 
  Solid experience in writing well-structured software code is needed to review work done by others. Exposure to Python is an advantage. 
  Understanding the security needs of the OT/IT interface is valuable. 
  Exposure to Artificial Intelligence and Neural networks is an advantage. 
  Ideally exposure to interfacing with corporate software such as Documentum, SAP, or similar systems would be expected.
 
  We encourage you to apply even if you may not meet every requirement above but can demonstrate that you have the background experience. Key to the position is experience with data generated from control systems, you understand what is needed to provide the outcomes, can design the applications to capture data as required, and present it so that it can be clearly understood.
 
  Location
  The Illawarra provides a picturesque coastal setting with ready access to Sydney, affordable housing, and a valued lifestyle mix. You can access both the beach and open spaces within minutes. Low travel times are supported by good road infrastructure and small peak conditions.  Wollongong is NSW’s third largest city and offers well-respected schools and supports its population with good medical, cultural, and recreational facilities.
 
  APPLY TODAY!
  To apply for this role, please submit your resume as well as a brief cover letter by emailing Only short-listed candidates will be contacted.

title: Data Engineer
description:
Data Engineer 
  
  We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced Data Engineer to join our new Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) team. This is a unique opportunity to work closely with ESG analysts and sustainability teams to identify and define ESG data requirements, design data models and ensure data quality and consistency. 
  
  Your role will see you engage with the business and technology SMEs on a frequent basis and expose you to opportunities to enhance your knowledge and understanding of the financial sector and market leading technologies. 
  
  You will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining ESG data infrastructure and analytics solutions. Ideally you will have a strong understanding of ESG data sources, data governance, data integration and data management. 
  
  
 Qualities and experience: 
 
  Design & develop data capture and analytics solutions. 
  Ensure data quality, consistency and integrity across data sources. 
  Develop and maintain data governance policies and procedures. 
  Monitor and optimize software performance and scalability. 
  Experience with cloud-based solutions such as AWS. 
  Excellent communication and collaboration skills. 
  Stay up to date with emerging trends and technologies in data engineering. 
 
 About the Corporate Operations Group 
  
  The Corporate Operations Group brings together specialist support services in Digital Transformation & Data, Technology, Operations, Human Resources, Business Services, Corporate Strategy & Solutions, and the Macquarie Group Foundation. We deliver service excellence to ensure Macquarie is open for business, deliver on transformational change, invest in our people and have deep relationships with our customers. 
  
  
 Our commitment to Diversity, Equity and Inclusion 
  
  The diversity of our people is one of our greatest strengths. An inclusive and equitable environment enables us to deliver innovative and sustainable outcomes for our people, clients, shareholders and communities. From day one, you'll be encouraged to be yourself and supported to perform at your best. If our purpose of 'empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future' is as inspiring to you as it is to us, please apply. With the right technology, support and resources, our people can work in a range of flexible ways. 
  
  We are committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity, equity and inclusion. We encourage candidates to speak with a member of our recruitment team if you require adjustments to our recruitment process to support you, and the type of working arrangements that would help you thrive.

Develop and maintain data governance policies and procedures.
Monitor and optimize software performance and scalability.
Experience with cloud-based solutions such as AWS.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
Stay up to date with emerging trends and technologies in data engineering.

title: Data Engineer
description:
Work type: 
      Full Time 
     
    
    
    
     
      Location: 
      Sydney

      Data & Analytics

     Data Engineer 
    
    
    
     Hello. We’re Virgin Australia. And we’re back (in a big way). 
      We’re the airline that’s always done things a little different. Our way. The Virgin way. For us, flying is so much more than simply taking off and landing (although we understand that is quite important). It’s about going the extra mile, in the air and on the ground, to create authentic experiences that put our guests firmly at the heart of everything we do. 
      No matter our role – we are united by our ambition to be the most loved airline in Australia, and always go one step further for our customers, colleagues and our wider community. 
      Who we’re looking for: 
      A strategic thinker who can tackle ambiguous problems, accelerate growth, bring definition and clarity to measurement, and creatively test & learn to accelerate value. 
      You’ll be great in this role if you: 
      
      Extensive experience with implementing Power BI solutions. 
      Experienced working with datasets and delivering complex visualization dashboards. 
      Knowledgeable in relational and big data architectures, data warehousing, data integration, data modelling, data optimisation and data analysis techniques. 
      Experienced in Cloud Data Warehouse services - Databricks (preferred), Snowflake, AWS Redshift or Azure. 
      Experienced in implementing end-to-end ETL processes/pipelines with advanced SQL on Cloud data platforms. 
      Experience working with Python and Unix. 
      Experience with Git or any distributed version control tools. 
      Hands on experience working with Jupyter or Databricks notebooks is desired. 
      Experienced with hands-on delivery of different software development cycles (e.g. Agile). 
      
     What you’ll get from us 
      We’re committed to looking after you, with some of the best benefits and conditions in the industry – including (but not limited to) 
      
      Heavily discounted air travel for you and your loved ones (including $1000 worth of travel credits per year) 
      Flexible working arrangements (including work hours and work from home) 
      Discounts on travel insurance, car hire, accommodation and experiences worldwide 
      Discounted Virgin Australia Lounge membership 
      Hospitality, retail, technology, beauty services and wellness discounts 
      Wellness support, including the betterme digital wellbeing platform 
      A comprehensive Employee Assistance Program, which offers confidential coaching and support from qualified professionals for all aspects of life – physical, mental, social and financial 
      Dress for Your Day – enjoy the freedom to wear whatever is appropriate for the type of work you do and the day you have ahead of you 
      
     Equality rules 
      We’re all individuals. We love that. That’s why we encourage applications from Indigenous Australians, people with disability, those from diverse cultural backgrounds, our friends in the LGBTQI+ community, and anyone else who wants to join our family. 
      COVID-19 
      The safety and security of our people, guests and operations come first. Always. That’s why we’ve put together a comprehensive ‘Mandatory COVID-19 Vaccination Policy’. In a nutshell, to work with us, you’ll need to comply with our (and the airport’s) rules and regulations. And be fully vaxxed. 
      Ready to apply? 
     We’re ready to hear from you.

title: FX - Production Support Engineer - FIX/ET exp
description:
The Production Support engineer acts as a professional in the Global FX IT support team, providing front line support to the trading and sales business community and external clients for the FX applications (Pricing and Trading) and their associated applications used by the Global Foreign Exchange business.  The team is responsible for management of the company's premier FX trading platforms providing execution, market data and post-trade services to external and internal clients.  You will be expected to balance between fast response (e.g., electronic trading monitoring and incident management) and longer-term activities (e.g., DevOps, release planning, security and audit reviews). A single day or even a single hour is likely to see a mix of both.  Working in Production Support means you'll use both creative and critical thinking skills to maintain application systems that are crucial to the daily operations of the firm. You'll work collaboratively in teams on a wide range of projects based on your primary area of focus. While learning to fix application and data issues as they arise, you'll also gain exposure to software development, testing, deployment, maintenance and improvement, in addition to production lifecycle methodologies and risk guidelines. Finally, you'll have the opportunity to develop professionally -and to grow your career in any direction you choose.  Key Responsibilities:  Act as a Production Support engineer in the Global Foreign Exchange IT front office production service team, providing first and second level support to the Trading, Sales, and business community for the suite of applications and their associated components.  Serve as single point of contact to the business, acting as the prime liaison for the application suite into the incident, problem, change, release, capacity, and continuity functions.  The role also includes but is not limited to:
 
   The providing of technical advice around the applications
   Ensuring that all issues are recorded and tracked in accordance with policy
   The reviewing and ownership of all outstanding issues
   Management and communication of major production incidents
   Oversight into the release of change into the production environment
   Active participation in regular capacity and continuity reviews
   User queries and Training
   Liaising with development teams on new application handover and 3rd line escalation of issues
   Application rollout activities (may include some weekend activities)
   The role also demands an early start (4 AM) on Mondays (including on Public Holidays) and working on public holidays
 
  Skills and experience required:  This role requires a wide variety of strengths and capabilities, including:
 
   Bachelor's degree in a technical subject or equivalent experience
   Basic knowledge of application development lifecycle
   Experience of at least 2 years supporting front office trading applications
   Ability to work collaboratively in teams and develop meaningful relationships to achieve common goals
   Familiarity with job scheduling/job dependencies
   Familiarity with production management i.e., capacity management, incident management, change management
   Ability to work under pressure and still deliver
   Understand business fundamentals of FIC electronic trading including FX (spot, forwards), Rates (cash, futures), and commodities.
   Written and verbal communication skills sufficient to communicate directly with business and technical partners at all levels.
   Systematic, fact-based decision making and problem solving.
   Unix: 
   
    Basic Linux command line and process management
     Some exposure to shell scripting (e.g., bash), Perl and/or python
   
   Networks: Basic understanding of TCP/IP, UDP, DNS
   Databases: 
   
    Required - Intermediate: Oracle SQL reporting, query profiling
     Optional - KDB
   
   Networks 
   
    Required - Intermediate: TCP/IP, UDP, network monitoring
     Beneficial - Low latency networks, multicast, routing
   
   Messaging: One or more of - LBM (Informatica Ultra Messaging), Tibco EMS, Solace
 
  This role offers an ambitious and proven Product Support Engineer, the opportunity to join a global bank and really make an impact through their own technical understanding and ability.  To learn more about this exciting new role please contact Simon Payne on 0401 334 612 or to apply please send your resume to email - simon.payne@marsrecruitment.com.au

title: Software Engineer (Data & Integration)
description:
Software Engineer (Data & Integration)
Who are we?
Drive Yello helps businesses efficiently manage last-mile delivery and connects them to gig economy drivers so they can meet the ever-increasing demand for convenience. We have ambitious growth plans and are looking for a passionate engineer to help drive the scaling of our business through data. We work with some of the largest retail clients here in Australia which include Woolworths, BWS, Dan Murphy’s, Coles, Terry White Chemmart just to name a few.
We have the opportunity to solve great technical challenges every day in an environment where every commit is adding value for our customers. We’re a great bunch of people working to help retailers provide the convenience customers are demanding.
Who are you?
As a Data and Integration Engineer, you will be empowered to help make the most out of our data here at Drive Yello. You understand the importance of data, and having the right data available in the right environments to the right people. Security and privacy will be at the heart of what you do, so you are comfortable identifying and managing sensitive information.
Working closely with our business intelligence team, you will be responsible for the preparation and transportation of our data to our data warehouse while also staging the data for our BI reporting. In parallel, you will be responsible for integrating with other internal and external systems to transport our data to where we can make the best use of it. You will build up a deep understanding of our data, and act as an interface between technical and non-technical stakeholders.
This position is key to unlocking our data and driving our future business decisions. The ideal candidate will be passionate about data, delivering clean solutions and thriving in a start-up environment.
You will work closely with the Head of Software Engineering while also working cross-functionally with our internal departments (Product, Marketing, Sales, Operations, and Community Experience) to further scale data at Yello.
What we are looking for:

 A minimum of 2 years of software engineering experience within an Agile development environment
 Experience with Python and Node.js
 Experience in SQL databases, MongoDB is a plus
 Solid experience working with 3rd party APIs, data pipelines and moving data across internal and external platforms
 Experience with AWS or Google Cloud
 Ability to interact with a range of stakeholders, with strong written and verbal communication skills
 A proactive can-do attitude, an appetite for learning, and a passion for data!

What we use:

 Google BigQuery
 MySQL, MongoDB, Redis
 AWS and Google Cloud

What you should do
If this sounds like it could be you, hit the apply button, we would love to hear from you!
Drive Yello is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Salary: $121,000.00 – $141,000.00 per year
Benefits:

 Professional development assistance
 Visa sponsorship
 Work from home

Schedule:

 Monday to Friday

Ability to commute/relocate:

 Sydney NSW: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Authorisation:

 Australia (Required)

title: Engineer
description:
Req ID: 31899 

Department: Insto IT Aust - Ops + Auto (30440346) 

Division: Group Technology (T77000) 

Location: Melbourne 
About the role 

 
Job Title: Engineer 

Location: Melbourne 

 Do work that matters on a large scale 
Collaborate with talented teams of engineers and leaders in their field 
Forget the suit stereotype – we encourage our people to dress for their day 

 At ANZ our purpose is to shape a world where people and communities thrive and to achieve this, we need a talented Engineer to join our Trade & Supply Chain (Institutional OACB) tribe. The tribe aims to delight customers by simplifying and automating the Operations, Middle Office, Credit Lending, Research and Core Banking services of Institutional. 

 As an Engineer you will work as part of an agile squad whose mission is to design, build, test and support applications and/or core banking platforms. You will work closely with other squad members to ensure the quality of our outcomes meets customer expectations. 

 What will your day look like 
Works in collaborative teams to build innovative solutions 
Utilises tools and best practices to build, verify and deploy solutions in the most efficient ways, enhancing tech division capabilities 
Provide ongoing support for platforms as required e.g. problem and incident management 
What will you bring? 

 We know not everyone will bring all of the skills and experience, and at ANZ we are focused on people bringing a growth mindset to their approach to work. Some of the skills we are looking for are below, but don’t worry if you don’t have all of these as learning on the job is the way we work. But back to some of the skills: 

 Good knowledge in Software Engineering combined with broad capability and a proven ability to innovate and adapt to the latest developments 

Fluent in one or more software development areas eg: Front/Back-end Engineer, Integration Engineer, full stack developer etc 
Have a thirst and willingness to expand knowledge with new technologies and techniques bringing benefits into the Technology Area 
Work closely within a team implementing application solutions 
Understand customer needs to make sound judgments 

 
The following skills/experiences are highly regarded:
 We are looking for T-shaped individuals (expert in some, novice in others) across these skillsets: 

 Strong Object Oriented Programming skills 
Core Java 8+, Spring 
Knowledge of Java testing techniques, including mocking and JUnit, Cucumber, code coverage 
React JS / Redux 
Restful API 
Docker Containerization, Open-shift, Kubernetes 
AWS/GCP Cloud 

 In this role, you will deal with many other technologies (examples below) so an openness to learning is the most important attribute 

 Spring Boot 
Spring Data JPA 
SQL, NoSQL 
Kafka Messaging 
Websphere/IBM MQ 
So, why join us? 

 There’s something special about being part of ANZ. From the moment you join us, you’re part of a team working towards a common goal: improving the financial wellbeing and sustainability of our millions of customers. 

 But it’s not just our customers who will feel your impact. You’ll feel it too. Because at ANZ, you’ll have the resources and community you need to take the next big step in your career, towards even bigger things in the future. 

 We offer a range of benefits tailored to the countries in which we operate including Health and Wellbeing programs and flexible working arrangements. 

 You’ll also enjoy working in a diverse and inclusive workplace where the different backgrounds, perspectives and life experiences of our people are celebrated. We encourage you to talk to us about any adjustments you may require to our recruitment process or the role itself. If you are a candidate with a disability, let us know how we can provide you with additional support. 

 To find out more about working at ANZ or to view other opportunities visit www.careers.anz.com. You may apply for this role by visiting ANZ Careers and searching for reference number 31899 

 Job Posting End Date 

 25/04/2023, 11.59pm, (Melbourne Australia)

title: UX Designer - Remote
description:
Work options: Hybrid
  The UX Designer needs to understand business requirements, the product vision and any technical limitations when designing solutions. They are also responsible for gathering customer feedback and translating these into user flows, customer journey maps, wireframes, mock-ups and/or prototypes. Using agile methodology the UX Designer partners with product and engineering through the build/learn/iterate framework to continually enhance the product to solve customer pain points.
  Responsibilities
 
   Closely partner with assigned squad Product Managers, Tech leads and UI lead to plan and deliver on their roadmaps, having a clear understanding of the product vision and business objectives.
   User Research – collaborate closely with PMs to conceive user research. Conduct research using relevant methodology such as interviews, focus groups, surveys to inform design and product roadmap. Use a pre- defined approach to document the output of the research.
   Voice of Customer – leverage all available means, from existing customer insight channels (sales, on-boarding, customer support) as well as user research to design product solutions that are useful, usable and delightful to our customers. Be the voice of the customer throughout product design discussions.
   Facilitation - lead or help facilitate white-boarding sessions, workshops and design jams with multidisciplinary teams during product ideation.
   UX artefacts – express your product thinking through Information Architecture, user journeys, personas, wireframes and interactive prototypes. Design and develop intuitive experiences that can be mapped directly to our customer needs. Optimise for a wide range of devices and interfaces.
   Delivery – uses agile best practices to ensure squad has a clear understanding of the user experience and design, delivering artefacts that align with product requirements and ones that can be used by engineering.
   Actively work with designers across squads to ensure there is alignment in the customer journey/ experience where relevant; create transparency into design backlog, the progress being made and to identify/ manage dependencies as well as risk.
   Contribute to, and helps shape, our Design System (HXUI) to establish consistent design aesthetics throughout the product.
   Communication – use established channels of communication to create transparency with key stakeholders on progress
   Educate stakeholders about research principles and the process of driving the integration of UX research data into everyday activities.
   Communication – uses established channels of communication to create transparency with key stakeholders on progress
 
  Knowledge & Experience Required:
 
   3+ years experience designing complex solutions for complete digital environments
   A solid grasp of user-centred design and design thinking, planning and conducting user research, user testing, rapid prototyping, and heuristic analysis
   Ability to clearly and effectively communicate design processes, ideas and solutions
   Experience using UX design best practices to design solutions, and a deep understanding of mobile-first and responsive design
   Proficient in standard UX software such as Sketch, Axure, InVision, UXPin, Balsamiq, Zeplin or a similar tool
   Highly proficient in wireframing and prototyping
   Has an appreciation of web technologies: HTML, CSS, and browser capabilities
   Up-to-date with the latest UX trends, techniques and technologies
   Tertiary qualification in user interaction, user experience, visual design and/or software development or related field
 
  Benefits
  As a leading health software company we take pride in building an inclusive and supportive working environment with opportunities for growth and development to help each employee reach their potential. Together, we can positively impact our customers to enable ideal healthcare!
 
   Flexible working environment- Hybrid work
   Attractive referral bonus programmes
   Career progression and learning and development opportunities
   Generous parental and annual leave schemes
   Telstra Rewards program- assess a number of employee discounts and benefits including discounts on shopping, gym memberships, movie tickets and health insurance
   Free Telstra mobile phone and plan for eligible employees

title: UX/UI Designer
description:
The Company 
  At IDE Group, we love working together to build better futures. Since 2003, IDE has grown over 100 medical technology businesses and realised over 500 projects across the medical technology landscape, including diagnostics, drug delivery, respiratory care, radiology, radiotherapy, surgical tools and equipment, wearable therapeutic, and diagnostic monitoring devices. 
  The Role 
  We are seeking a UX/UI Designer with a passion and desire to create great new products with our clients. 
  The purpose of the role is to 
 
   Collaborate with project teams to effectively plan out assigned activities/tasks to achieve defined goals. This will entail gathering user insights, researching, and evaluating user needs to deliver intuitive designs that provide an outstanding user experience.
   Plan and implement new designs and optimize existing user interfaces.
   Generate digital assets that combine creativity and awareness of design requirements.
   Understand and apply usability engineering principles to optimize user interface designs.
   Conducts assigned activities/tasks following prescribed methods, seeking appropriate review and supervision to achieve appropriate quality.
   Co-ordinate and complete effective reviews of assigned tasks.
   Manage assigned activities/tasks and expectations of relevant stakeholders.
   Communicate effectively and timely on the status of assigned activities.
   Adjust to meet goals and commitments made.
  
  Desired Skills and Experience 
 
   Prerequisites for this position include a university qualification in Visual Communication, Industrial Design or similar discipline, and a minimum of five years’ experience working in new product development, preferably in medical device.
   Ability to work on multiple projects, presenting design concepts, and consulting with your stakeholders on how to improve it.
   Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to design solutions and achieve business outcomes.
   Ability to stay current with technology and design tools.
   Can conduct user research and testing.
   Exceptional digital design UX/UI skills applicable on wireframes, websites and apps.
   Ability to organise and hold meetings on Microsoft Teams.
   Ability to work autonomously and as part of an agile team.
   Excellent time management, organisational and communication skills.
   A demonstrated ability to apply original thought in solving open problems by utilising a methodical and logical approach to identify the root cause of an issue, developing a design direction and vision, and delivering solutions that are fresh and novel.
   A demonstrated ability to carry out and/or manage user/stakeholder/market research, and an ability to understand, interpret and utilise results to produce great design.
   Proven product development skills and experience from concept right through to delivery
   Ability to communicate design approach from requirements through to execution
   Understanding of new product development under design controls as specified by a Quality Management System (ISO9001, ISO13485, GMP or similar)
   Computer Skills (required): Microsoft Office suite (inc Powerpoint & Project), Adobe Suite (Xd, Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, AfterEffects. CAD software (preferably Solidworks and/or Creo/Pro-e). If you are ready and have the right skills, experience, and most importantly, attitude, then a role with a truly unique group of people passionate about using design and entrepreneurship to create new businesses, awaits.
  
  Why you will love working with us 
 
   Opportunity to work on a variety of projects with increased learning opportunities
   Mentoring program to ensure your career progresses where you want to go
   Flexible working options, including working from home
   Employee Assistance Program
   Learning management system to complete learning when you want to with 2 hours per week allocated to learning activities
   Global opportunities
  
  How to Apply? 
  If you are ready to be challenged but fulfilled, have the right skills, and experience but most importantly the right attitude, then a truly unique role in a life-changing product development company awaits. Apply now with a resume and cover letter at hr@idegroup.com.au with UX/UI Designer as the subject heading.

title: Senior UX Designer
description:
Employment Type
  Permanent
 
 
   Closing Date
  29 Apr 2023 11:59pm
 
 
   Job Title
  Senior UX Designer
 
 
   Job Summary
  As a Senior UX Designer you are passionate about designing revolutionary digital products and services, that transform customer’s experience. You thrive in a creative and agile team environment, and working closely with your stakeholders to define and implement cohesive innovative solutions that meet the needs of customers. You are a trusted advisor that guides product decisions through user research, customer development, rapid prototyping and iterative feedback loops. Your ability to quickly incubate, test and implement solutions that deliver improved customer and business outcomes, is what makes you outstanding in your role.
 
   Job Description
 
 
 
   First Nations First
 
 
   We acknowledge the First Nations Peoples of Australia as traditional owners and custodians of the land and waters. Australia’s First Peoples are the oldest continuous culture on the planet. We humbly pay respects to their Elders past and present.
 
 
 
   Program overview
 
 
   Given recent data breaches at major Australian companies, Belong is undertaking a program to determine how we identify customers and secure their information. This service design led program is uncovering attitudes, perceptions, and behaviours regarding identity and security, and are we looking for 2 Senior UX Designers to lead workstreams owning the design and delivery of recommendations from this program. This ownership spans problem identification and shaping, all the way through to production ready designs.
 
 
 
   Typical duties
 
 
   While this role will be responsible for the entire product design lifecycle, a typical day will see you partnering with our service design team and a Principal Designer to facilitate discovery workshops and design concepts based on the insights from these workshops. You'll also facilitate customer research activities such as semi-structured interviews and evaluative usability tests to identify unmet customer needs and test concepts.
 
 
 
   You'll be hands on in Figma, using our robust UI Kit, to create screen flows, wireframes, and prototypes of new digital experiences across web and app. You'll also provide mentorship and guidance to a mid-weight UX Designer assisting with the creation of design artefacts.
 
 
 
   Experience required
 
 
   Activities - workshop facilitation, problem framing, generative / exploratory research methods, stakeholder management, low to mid fidelity wireframing, prototyping (in Figma), experience working in and contributing to a design system
 
 
   Tools - Figma, Miro, familiarity with Askable
 
 
 
   Nice to haves
 
 
  
   
     Consulting / agency experience
   
  
   
     Financial services experience
   
  
   
     Native app design experience
   
 
 
   Fun fact: research has shown that women usually think they need to meet 100% of a job’s criteria before they apply. Men often apply if they meet 60% of the criteria.
 
 
   We want as many people from as many backgrounds as possible to apply for all our jobs. Send us an application even if you don’t tick every box.
 
 
 
   We’re flexible
 
 
   We’re all about flexibility and choice at work. Will you choose to work from home, in our office workspace, or on the go? Somewhere regional or the city? We want you to work where, when, and how you're most engaged, safe, and productive – wherever in Australia that may be.
 
 
 
   About Belong
 
 
   It feels good to bring people together.
 
 
   As a telco, we’re making our world a more inclusive place. That means giving Australians the tools they need to get things done in the digital world. Oh, and we’re doing that while being 100% carbon neutral.
 
 
 
   As an organisation, we're focused on having a customer-first mindset and delivering effortless customer experiences.
 
 
 
   As a workplace, we’re building a community of people who bring their whole selves to work. Workplaces can be brutally bland and that’s not good for anyone. Difference makes us all better and we’re always trying to get better.
 
 
 
   Our values
 
 
   We’re here to make our world a more inclusive place. That’s reflected in our four values:
 
 
  
   
     We care.
   
  
   
     We’re better together.
   
  
   
     We make it simple.
   
  
   
     We’re change makers.
   
 
 
 
   They help remind us that we care about the work we do and that, if we do it together, we can make our world a better place for our team and our customers.
list: Consulting / agency experience
Financial services experience
Native app design experience
We care.
We’re better together.
We make it simple.
We’re change makers.

title: User Experience Designer
description:
User Experience Designer
    
     Here at Maitland City Council, we are going through an exciting period of change with a focus on Customer Driven Transformation, where it’s our vision to ‘deliver un-Council like services’. As part of this we’re seeking a User Experience Designer, to join the team and help shape Maitland’s future.
     Your challenge  Your challenge will be to design reimagined digital experiences, that deliver on our transformational vision and make things easier for our customers. You will be responsible for designing our user experience (UX) and user interface (UI) for all current and future customer facing digital experiences at Council (websites, portals, intranet, phone, mobile, apps), with a particular emphasis on the introduction of new or redesigned self-service options for our customers.
     You will take validated customer needs and use your creativity and skills to craft amazing designs, while continuously responding to an ever-changing digital landscape. The UX Designer will take ownership of Council’s Digital Design System, have the ability to undertake user research, and develop design artefacts that guide their thinking.
     While you are doing all that you will partner and build relationships across the organisation with key stakeholders including Service Designers, Digital Transformation team members, developers, and delivery teams to design, test and validate fit for purpose solutions that deliver on Council’s digital experience ambitions.  
    This is an exciting opportunity where great work gets noticed, and it will have a real impact on both our fast-growing community and Maitland City Council.   About You
     You will have a design thinking mindset, coupled with previous experience as a UX/UI Designer with an exciting portfolio that showcases your talent.   You will be a creative, curious, empathetic, willing to roll your sleeves up, have fun along the way and deliver at pace. You will have the ability to undertake iterative design, apply heuristics and design principles and complete user testing with your design work.   You will be experienced with design tools such as Figma and Adobe Creative Cloud with the ability to coach, mentor and guide others whilst increasing the organisations digital prototyping and UX/UI capability.  Living and breathing our Guiding Principles, your main focus will be the customer experience. You will work with stakeholders to bring about improved digital services and experiences that lift digital uptake and makes it easier for our customers to engage with Council.  You will champion the latest design trends and best practice and inspire others within the organisation about what great design looks and feels like.  If this sounds like you, we’d love to hear from you.   
    Benefits
     This is a permanent full time role, working 35 hours per week with a competitive salary on offer.  Council also offers a range of other benefits for its employees including:
    
      Flexible work arrangements with a range of options to suit.
      Great leave entitlements including long service leave after five years, Health and Wellbeing leave and Paid Parental Leave
      Ongoing training and development including access to Council’s Educational Assistance Program, that can provide financial support for study costs and up to 6 study leave days per year.
    
     If your seeking a great team, progressive culture, rewarding work and career development opportunities than this is for you.
    
     Questions?  Should you have any questions, please contact Bridget Wilks, Coordinator Customer Experience, on 02 4939 1024.
    
     To Apply
     To apply for this opportunity, submit your resume and cover letter. In the application process for this role you will be required to address targeted questions, with each response limited to 400 words, in place of addressing the entire essential criteria.  Applications close: Sunday 30 April 2023  Please note, prior to an offer of employment being made, recommended candidates will be required to undertake a medical assessment (including drug and alcohol testing). Council also completes a range of other pre-employment checks which may include reference checks, psychometric testing or a criminal history check. For more information about the recruitment process, visit our website and search ‘work with us’.  We are a 2023 Circle Back Initiative Employer – we commit to respond to every applicant
list: Flexible work arrangements with a range of options to suit.
Great leave entitlements including long service leave after five years, Health and Wellbeing leave and Paid Parental Leave
Ongoing training and development including access to Council’s Educational Assistance Program, that can provide financial support for study costs and up to 6 study leave days per year.

title: UX Designer
description:
It is an exciting time at Macquarie Bank as we look to expand our team of experienced designers, Business Analysts and Subject Matter Experts. 
  
  As a UX Designer you will drive design activities for major features but also work incrementally to optimise and enhance the customer experience. Collaborating with a dynamic team of designers, researchers, business analysts, you will build a shared user research platform, facilitate ideation, research and validation and then share this with the wider team. Finally, you will collaborate closely with developers to understand the feasibility of your ideas and then bring them to life. 
  
  
 In this role you will: 
 
  Gather ideas from stakeholders, such as UX, UI and Service Designers, Product Owners, Business Analysts, Architects, Engineers and other experts across the business, through workshops, kick offs and feedback sessions 
  Collaborate with developers from early stage to pre-launch to generate feasible concepts and solutions 
  Design and facilitate workshops and co-creation sessions for ideation and iteration 
  Identify insights from customer research through unmoderated and moderated techniques, interviews, surveys and assist with research recruitment 
  Bring your research to life through personas, customer journeys, service blueprints, stories or scenarios and wireframes 
  Iterate your designs with feedback from user research and testing 
  Work with the team to identify an incremental way to build out designs in a way that can be measured and learned from 
  Synthesise and communicate your findings and recommendations to stakeholders in the team and across the company 
 
 What we're looking for: 
 
  Designers who thrive in a collaborative team, with excellent communication and interpersonal skills 
  Passionate design advocates, committed to best practice, process improvements and sharing ideas and inspiration within the team 
  Problem solvers who love big challenges, tackle them using a collaborative workflow, with the customer front of mind 
  If this sounds like you, please send a CV and portfolio. We'd like you to be able to show your abilities to us in an interview, through your portfolio showcasing experience where you have previously shipped UX design for digital products. 
 
 Design at Macquarie Bank 
  
  The design function and Macquarie, headed by our Chief Design Officer, helps envision and deliver how customers experience our various products and services across multiple digital channels. We span across the full design spectrum, from early-stage conceptual design and research to delivering pixel-perfect interfaces on our digital platforms. We follow a human-centered, data-led approach to design and seek to win by collaborating with our partners and helping deliver exceptional customer experiences as a team. 
  
  
 Our commitment to Diversity, Equity and Inclusion 
  
  The diversity of our people is one of our greatest strengths. An inclusive and equitable environment enables us to deliver innovative and sustainable outcomes for our people, clients, shareholders and communities. From day one, you'll be encouraged to be yourself and supported to perform at your best. If our purpose of 'empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future' is as inspiring to you as it is to us, please apply. With the right technology, support and resources, our people can work in a range of flexible ways. 
  
  We are committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity, equity and inclusion. We encourage candidates to speak with a member of our recruitment team if you require adjustments to our recruitment process to support you, and the type of working arrangements that would help you thrive. 
  
  <

title: UI Designer
description:
Posted: 23/03/2023
  
 
  Closing Date: 23/04/2023
  
 
  Job Type: Temporary 
 
 
  Location: Bondi Beach, NSW 
 
 
  Job Category: Administration and Office,Design and Architecture,IT 
 
 
  Surf Life Saving Australia (SLSA) exists to save lives, create great Australians, and build better communities. As one of Australia's most respected community organisations and a world leader in lifesaving, coastal public safety, rescue, and education services, SLSA provides many ways to get involved as a volunteer or employee. 
  With over 180,000 members and 315 affiliated Surf Life Saving Clubs, we represent the largest volunteer movement of its kind in Australia, and the world. 
  SLSA encompasses coastal safety, elite sports teams, public relations, partnerships & national fundraising. We rely heavily on the support of the community to continue to provide this vital service that help keep our beaches safe and protect our Australian way of life. 
 
 
 
  Job Description
 
  
 
 
  This is a 12 month fixed-term role and we would also consider a part-time arrangement. 
  This role requires interaction with staff in multiple physical locations through regular video calls while working remotely or from either our Sydney Bondi Beach or Brisbane Bowen Hills office. Occasional trips to the Sydney or Brisbane offices will be required. 
  All applicants will need to submit a portfolio of their previous work in either a PDF format or link to an online portfolio. 
  Responsibilities:
   
   
  
   Create wireframes, User flows, prototypes and design specification for digital product. 
   Collaborate with the development team to ensure designs are feasible and align with technical requirements. 
   Conduct user research, analyse feedback, and integrate findings in to design decisions. 
   Providing daily updates to assigned tasks. 
   Develop a design system and maintain design consistency across all digital products. 
   Keep up to date with latest UI/UX trends and technologies. 
   In-depth knowledge and skills with interface design tools. 
   Working knowledge from design ideas to creation and delivery: lifecycle management from design to testing, and production, 
   User latest software programs to deliver all work. 
   
 
 
 
  Desired Skills and Experience
  
 
  Qualifications 
  
   Bachelor's degree in graphic design, UX/UI Design, or a related field, or equivalent relevant experience. 
   
  Knowledge and experience 
  
   At least 3 years of professional experience as a Graphic Designer/UX/UI Designer. 
   Strong portfolio showcasing your design and UX/UI skills. 
   Working knowledge from design ideas to creation and delivery: lifecycle management from design to, testing and production. 
   In-depth knowledge and skill with interface design tools 
   
  Skills and Attributes 
  
   Excellent attention to detail and the ability to produce high-quality work. 
   Excellent communication skills and the ability to work well in a team. 
   Strong time management, organisational skills and the ability to meet deadlines by prioritising and multi-tasking. 
   Collaborate with the development team to ensure designs are feasible and align with technical requirements. 
   Great attention to detail. 
   Ability to work autonomously and meet deadlines. 
   Highly motivated and enthusiastic, with a determination to help others. 
   A flexible approach to work hours. 
   
  Experience working with Frontend systems developed in VueJS would be of great advantage. 
  How to Apply: 
  If you can demonstrate your capabilities and attributes in the above areas and have the motivation, desire, and skill set to be challenged in this role and further your career with one of Australia's most iconic brands, APPLY NOW! 
  This is a full-time position, based at our office at Bondi Beach. 
  Please note: only applicants with the eligibility to work in Australia will be considered. 
  SLSA is an equal opportunity employer with a commitment to safeguarding children and young people. All candidates may be required to undertake a working with children check.
