title: EL1 Business Analyst (Digital Delivery)
description:
About the Organization:
 This leading Federal government agency supports Australian’s in achieving their goals and helps them to live a better life. Their work has an impact on a significant area in the social sector, and you can contribute to the difference that they make in this role. This agency is known for having a great culture across different teams and have excellent office locations in Melbourne or Geelong. 

 
About the role:
 The EL1 Business Analyst (Digital Delivery) will be responsible for developing and improving digital solutions to enhance the experience and objectives of Participants of the Agency. You will be part of the Digital Division, responsible for implementing enhanced digital applications on the Salesforce platform to improve the effectiveness and efficiency of providers, to support greater outcomes for participants. It enables the effective management of plans through digital platforms that interact with the Agency and relevant providers. 

 
Responsibilities may include but are not limited to:
 
 
 Facilitate the identification of digital system related business needs and processes, monitor and collate data, identify competing demands, organisational changes and new responsibilities 
 Evaluate effectiveness of proposed solutions and design in conjunction with stakeholders and subject matter experts 
 Provide project level analysis and producing required analysis documentation. 
 Work with stakeholders to capture business needs and translating requirements into User stories in a simple format that all stakeholders can understand. 
 Document end user journeys, process mapping from as-is analysis to future state processing and improving end user experience. 
 Use and work with software platforms such as Jira, Salesforce, Mulesoft and SAP 
 MANDATORY 

 
 
 Experience working in a similar role under Australian rules and regulations 
 Ability to synthesise and analyse information, prioritising of Application Program Interface (API) requirements, ability to manage competing priorities while maintaining high work standards and accuracy 
 High level engagement skills including planning, communication (written and oral), presentation, facilitation, evaluation and requirements writing. 
 Ability to be self-motivated, responsive and flexible in an environment with time pressures and multiple priorities. 
 Experience in coordinating and assisting in the management of complex cases 
 Excellent written and oral communication skills, and proficiency in the use of IT systems including Microsoft Office 
 Demonstrated commitment to ongoing professional development 
 The Agency Worker Screening Check. This is only applicable to some positions within the Agency that require the occupant to have access to classified Australian Government information. 
 Current Police Check, o ability to obtain one 
 
Desirable skills to have for the role:
 
 
 Competent with IT systems including knowledge of Application Programming Interfaces 
 Ability to develop and maintain strong relationships with key internal and external stakeholders 
 
What you will bring to the role:
 
 
 Strong communication and interpersonal skills. 
 Experience in building relationships both with internal and external stakeholders. 
 Ability to work within and across teams, the ability to adapt quickly to a changing environment 
 Ability to manage confidential and sensitive information. 
 Ability to prioritise and allocate tasks in an efficient manner while also maintaining high work standards and accuracy. 
 
How to apply:
 Chandler Macleod is an equal opportunity employer as part of our commitment to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, disability and culturally and linguistics candidates are also encouraged to apply. 

 
Mandatory: Australian Citizenship required to work within Federal Government. 

 Please click ‘APPLY” to upload your details and resume to be considered for this role. You can also send in your resumes directly to Claudia Leiva at claudia.leiva@chandlermacleod.com to be considered for this opportunity. 

 Applications close 15.00 PM AEST 10th April 2023

title: Data Engineer / Data Analyst
description:
Work in a agile team delivering deep expertise to our stakeholders. Your contribution will have impact and will play an integral part in transforming enterprise data using data modelling techniques by leveraging technology and data analytics. This role will see you working closely with key stakeholders across all aspects of data governance, data quality , governance data model and stake holder management. 
  
  
 To excel in this role, you will be: 
 
  Previously worked closely with data architect or data modellers , can independently work on data analysis , data modelling. 
  proficient in manipulating data and drawing insights from large data sets using SQL, and power BI. 
  highly proficient in data preparation and integration, able to design, develop and modify data models and troubleshoot performance issues 
  detailed, focused and proud of your sense of technical design strategy. 
  excellent at stakeholder management across multiple levels of engagement 
  proactive and have great communication skills 
  good in doing downstream analysis and understanding end to end data flow when multiple systems are involved. 
  a natural collaborator with a learning mindset, happy to share knowledge and learn from others 
  able to understand technical requirements and translate them into non-technical language and vice versa. 
  experienced with working on Agile delivery 
 
 Core skills: 
 
  tertiary qualifications, preferably in a quantitative subject e.g., computer science, engineering, mathematics or finance. 
  at least 5 years of experience building data solutions for advanced analytics. 
  Expected to have strong atleast 5 to 7 years of hands on experience in SQL 
  strong knowledge in SQL and various scheme models. 
  familiarity with data governance, data quality and control frameworks would certainly be useful in this role 
  able to creatively use data and insights to uncover new opportunities, identify root causes and underlying risks to recommend solutions to the business 
 
 About the Corporate Operations Group 
  
  The Corporate Operations Group brings together specialist support services in Digital Transformation & Data, Technology, Operations, Human Resources, Business Services, Corporate Strategy & Solutions, and the Macquarie Group Foundation. We deliver service excellence to ensure Macquarie is open for business, deliver on transformational change, invest in our people and have deep relationships with our customers. 
  
  
 Our commitment to Diversity, Equity and Inclusion 
  
  The diversity of our people is one of our greatest strengths. An inclusive and equitable environment enables us to deliver innovative and sustainable outcomes for our people, clients, shareholders and communities. From day one, you'll be encouraged to be yourself and supported to perform at your best. If our purpose of 'empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future' is as inspiring to you as it is to us, please apply. With the right technology, support and resources, our people can work in a range of flexible ways. 
  
  We are committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity, equity and inclusion. We encourage candidates to speak with a member of our recruitment team if you require adjustments to our recruitment process to support you, and the type of working arrangements that would help you thrive.

title: Technical Business Analyst - Data Transformation
description:
We have an exciting program of work, as we embark on our journey to build the innovative and future-ready Data Platform to help Macquarie businesses meet customer and regulatory needs. 
  
  As a business analyst, you will own and drive delivery of the solutions for the Commodities business using big data and other appropriate tooling available to us. You will also work with other business divisions to ensure requirements are taken into consideration for cross-divisional initiatives. 
  
  With experience in a similar role, you will"have an"agile mindset and a"delivery track record across a range of complex and diverse projects. Your forward thinking, stakeholder and relationship management skills will be key to drive the right business outcomes. 
  
  You will work alongside the Chief Product owner, Lead Engineers, Agile team of Engineers, Business, and technology stakeholders and other technical teams with a key focus to drive innovation, efficiency and continuously deliver business outcomes. 
  
  
 To be successful in this role you will have: 
 
  A solid business analyst background preferably in the banking and financial services or data space. 
  Excellent Communication and stakeholder management skills 
  Problem-solving mindset 
  Experience with big data and/or a data lake, and the challenges it brings 
  Strong analytical skills with the ability to define efficient solutions based on input from stakeholders and map technical"needs to business outcomes. 
  Proficiency in SQL to query and analyse data from various sources. 
  Knowledge in data modelling methodologies would be advantageous. 
  Experience in Data Engineering and/or ETL tools is useful. 
  Ability to articulate and document at the right level of technical specifications/data requirements to data engineering team 
  Comfortable with owning and eliciting requirements 
  Strong experience with Confluence and Jira 
  Enjoy owning and driving small to medium projects

  The Corporate Operations Group brings together specialist support services in Digital Transformation & Data, Technology, Operations, Human Resources, Business Services, Business Improvement & Strategy, and the Macquarie Group Foundation. We deliver service excellence to ensure Macquarie is open for business, deliver on transformational change, invest in our people and have deep relationships with our customers.

title: Analyst, Strategy Execution
description:
Job no: 787222 
  
 Business unit: Strategy and Innovation 
  
 Position location: 395 Bourke St 
  
 Work type: Permanent Full time 
  
 Location: VIC- Melbourne CBD 
  
  
 It's more than a career at NAB. It's about more opportunity, more moments to make a difference and more focus on you. 
  
  Your job is just one part of your life. When you bring your ideas, energy, and hunger for growth to us, you'll be recognised and rewarded for your contribution in return. You'll have our support to excel for our customers, deliver positive change for our communities and grow your career. 
  
  It's a good time to see what more you can find at NAB as an 
 Analyst Strategy Execution, within the Execution and Investment team, part of our broader Strategy and Innovation Business unit. 
  
  
 The role 
  
  As the Analyst Strategy Execution, you are responsible for delivering quality analysis requirements and recommendations to support the broader Domains Teams. 
  
  This role handles end-to-end coordination for the analysis and insights that drive strategic recommendations for NAB domains including: 
 
  Data analysis including extraction and table maintenance to support detailed reporting 
  Produce custom data extracts to enable bespoke analysis 
  Communicate strategic recommendations, both written (PowerPoint reports & decks) and verbally 
  Engage with business stakeholders and Domain leaders to optimize data utilization 
  Maintain and build PowerBI reports 
 If you are a colleague who loves problem solving, can take initiative and produce results, whilst working collaboratively and autonomously as a team. We'd love to hear from you! 
  
  
 Your opportunity 
 
  Ensure effective and complete data tables are maintained and accurate 
  Enhance key elements of data analytics as required to deploy and run regular domain metrics reporting and adhoc requests 
  Key member of the Domain Efficiency team, contributing to managing the breadth of work required to build and run domain metrics reporting 
  Become a subject matter expert across the bank in domain efficiency 
  Contribute to team knowledge-sharing and learning to ensure the appropriate skill mix required in the Domain Efficiency team 
  Work closely with other members of the Domain Efficiency team to improve data quality and processes to optimise effectiveness. 
  Engage with members of Domain Orchestration, business stakeholders and domain leaders to support delivery and understanding of key drivers of metrics 
  Leverage data capability across S&I to drive value by enhancing insights and creating process/analytic efficiencies 
  Support the implementation of Strategy & Innovation priorities as directed by the leadership team 
  Fully leverage structured and unstructured data to drive the most effective decision-making across Execution & Investment 
  Contribute to the high-performance culture of the team 
 
 What you will bring 
 
  Minimum 1+ years' experience as an Analyst (and or similar role), ideally with banking/financial services acumen, within an in-house corporate development, or investment banking, chartered accounting firm or consulting business. 
  Strong data related technical skills (e.g., SQL database, PowerBI, advanced Excel) 
  Ability to interact, influence and work with multiple stakeholders at all levels 
  A passion for solving problems and delivering high quality analysis 
  Relevant tertiary qualifications (desired) 
 
 Applications will close Friday 5 th May 2023 
  
  
 Make a difference through your work 
  At NAB, we work together to deliver exceptional outcomes that exceed our customers' expectations. We're an ASX listed organisation that has been serving Australian communities for more than 160 years. We're investing in positive change and our work changes the future of banking. Our colleagues have an impact far beyond work, and you'll be part of a team that is helping to solve some of society's biggest challenges. 
  
  
 Join NAB 
  If you think this role is the right fit for you, we invite you to apply. If you require any reasonable adjustments to the recruitment process or the role, please let the recruitment consultant know. 
  
  To be eligible to apply, you must have Australian or New Zealand citizenship or Australian permanent residency status. Please note candidate screening and interviews may be conducted prior to the closing date of the job advert. 
  
  
 Please note unsolicited CVs from agencies will not be accepted. 
  
  Please note candidate screening methodologies and interviews may be conducted prior to the closing date of the job advertisement 
  
  
 Advertised: 19 Apr 2023 6:00 AM AUS Eastern Standard Time 
  
 Closing: 05 May 2023 11:55 PM AUS Eastern Standard Time

title: Group Treasury | Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
Business Intelligence Analyst 
  
  Be at the heart of our business as we innovate and invest for a better future. 
  
  In Group Treasury, you will work in the financial centre of Macquarie, driving real change for our businesses. You will be part of a rapidly evolving function that is curious and not afraid to ask, 'how can we do better?' A team that is bold, always challenging the status quo, seeing solutions where others see obstacles. Join a team that is generous with its skills, knowledge, and expertise, so that we can achieve great things together. 
  
  
 Group Treasury Platforms, Data and Digital (PDD) 
  
  The Group Treasury Target Funding Profile Automation is a diverse, highly skilled, agile and delivery focused team responsible for automation of key processes used to manage Macquarie's Funding and liquidity positions. 
  
  
 What impact will you have? 
  
  In this role, you will work with various stream leads across the team to design and develop data analytics solutions and transform the processes from data acquisition to reporting. Your key responsibilities will be to: 
 
  Design, develop, test, and implement solutions based on business requirements. 
  Participate in solution design discussions, develop, maintain solution documentation, and build prototypes. 
  Identify gaps, opportunities and recommend solutions for business problems. 
  Adhere to the Agile methodology of project delivery, release management and change control processes. 
 
 What skills will you use? 
 
  Intermediate/Advanced SQL skills - Demonstrated at least 1 year of experience along with related data technologies. 
  The ability to extract and transform data from multiple sources. 
  Knowledge of data modelling concepts and data quality controls 
  Good communication skills 
  Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related Engineering courses 
 Other desirable skills which are advantageous but not essential: 
 
  Experience in Alteryx, Power BI and Python 
  Understanding of software development life cycle and methodologies 
 
 Want to apply? 
  
  We are committed to a diverse, equitable and inclusive workplace, where different ideas are embraced. We believe that flexibility is a key driver to our people's success and welcome the opportunity to discuss what flexibility means to you. 
  
  We are working to a hybrid model to support your development and strengthen your working relationships. Successful candidates for this role will be working from our Sydney office at least 3x days per week. If you are not based in Sydney, please highlight on your CV if you are wishing to relocate or otherwise. 
  
  Help us transform our Group Treasury function and evolve the future of finance at Macquarie, apply now!

title: Business Analyst - Client Lifecycle Management
description:
The Client Lifecycle Management and Screening Technology team have an opening for a Business Analyst. We are an agile team responsible for the technology that support the client onboarding, maintenance and review process for all of Macquarie's institutional clients and we have a bold vision to transform how this is done through digitizing the customer journey. We are also transforming the way we work so as to build high performing scrum teams that support this product vision. 
  
  We have an opening in the team for a Business Analyst to join and work on various initiatives covering the migration of data from legacy systems to the strategic data master and automation of data through workflows. You will work closely with stakeholders to understand business requirements, define business concepts and understand data requirements. This includes gathering, eliciting and leading refinement for features/stories with an Agile approach, working closely with team members on the design of the solution and ensuring business requirements and outcomes are clearly understood by the scrum team. You will act as a liaison between business and product teams and provide walkthrough of users stories to the scrum team to assist with the understanding of requirements and provide support and guidance to the scrum team during delivery. 
  
  To excel in this role: 
 
  You will ideally have experience in the regulatory domain, in particular, KYC and AML , which could include experience with systems such as Fenergo, BAE NetReveal, WorldCheck One and Regulatory Data Corp 
  Domain knowledge of counterparty data 
  Experience working on data migration projects or digitilisation projects 
  Strong working knowledge of Confluence, JIRA and SQL 
  Previous experience working with distributed teams across different time zones

  The Corporate Operations Group brings together specialist support services in Digital Transformation & Data, Technology, Operations, Human Resources, Business Services, Corporate Strategy & Solutions, and the Macquarie Group Foundation. We deliver service excellence to ensure Macquarie is open for business, deliver on transformational change, invest in our people and have deep relationships with our customers.

title: Data Analyst, Data & Analytics
description:
At EY, you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.
 
  If we inspire you to do the work you love, will you still call it work?
 
  What's in it for you?
  We are seeking a Data Analyst to join our EY Data and Analytics team ideally in our Melbourne and Sydney offices but can also be based in any of the major Australian cities. Working with a number of high profile clients this role is offered on a flexible, full-time basis.
 
  You will help shape, change, and deliver a data management roadmap to improve and enhance the value and re-usability of data, through modern and evolving data management practices and frameworks.  As a Data Analyst, you will support our clients in defining and implementing a data journey aligned with their strategic objectives, you will work with a diverse range of stakeholders and data teams to uplift the current data quality management capabilities of a number of different high profile client groups.
 
  What we're looking for
 
   Translating business questions to data and analysis requirements; carry out analysis, visualization and presentation.
   Performing ad-hoc analysis to solve business problems and support decisions.
   Design and build data products, such as Power BI dashboards, including defining the data models.
   Surfacing and sharing insights, typically from internal corporate data, using a dashboard.
   Run human centred design sessions with end-users.
   Communicating and influencing stakeholders.
   Coaching non-data experts how to use data.
 
 
  Skills and attributes for success
 
   Experience in a hands-on role interpreting and telling stories with data.
   Curious and business outcome focused with an ability to break down a complex problem and work out how to solve it.
   Evidence of numerical and technical aptitude strong collaboration skills having worked with business stakeholders at different levels of seniority.
   Comfortable working across a wide range of data sets and systems:
   
     Expertise in cleansing, combining and processing data.
     Have knowledge of SQL, with knowledge of Python an advantage.
     Familiarity with Power BI and ideally data manipulation tools (e.g. Alteryx and Daraiku).
   
 
 
  What we can offer you
 
   Explore how a career at EY is yours to build at www.ey.com/au/careerdevelopment
   Discover how, when and where you can work at www.ey.com/au/flexibility
   Learn about our commitment to DE&I at www.ey.com/au/diversity-inclusiveness
   Understand how our benefits can support you at www.ey.com/au/benefits
 
 
  Acknowledgement of Country
  EY acknowledges the Traditional Owners and Custodians of the lands on which EY offices are located around Australia. We pay our respects to their cultures, and to their Elders — past, present, and emerging. Find out more about our vision for reconciliation at www.ey.com/au/reconciliation
 
  Apply now… we’re over 9,000 perspectives in Australia and we’re ready to welcome yours.
 
  At EY we take inclusivity seriously, and we’re committed to removing barriers and improving the employment prospects of people with disability or long-term health conditions. We encourage you to share any support and adjustments you need to be your best and participate equitably in our recruitment process. We understand sharing your needs with us can be daunting, so if you have questions before or during your application, we welcome you to get in touch at contactrecruitment@au.ey.com or +61 3 8650 7788 (option 2). Anything you tell us will be kept completely confidential.
 
  The exceptional EY experience. It’s yours to build.
 
  The preferred applicant will be subject to employment screening by EY or by their external third party provider. Regarding this role, the minimum salary is $75,000 including 10.5% superannuation.
 
  EY | Building a better working world  EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.  Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.  Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.

title: Intern - Data Analyst/Business Analyst (Proptech Startup) [vw98]
description:
** This role is at St Trinity Property Group (not for Hatch)
Hatch is supporting St Trinity Property Group to find a great Data Analyst/Business Analyst - Intern to join their data analytics team. Hatch exists to level the playing field for people as they discover a career that’s right for them. We model this in our hiring process for our partners like St Trinity Property Group.
Applying here is the first step in the hiring process for this role.
About the role at St Trinity Property Group
An internship in systems, tech, and data can provide a wide range of experiences for interns, including working on projects like CRM systems, telephony platforms, scheduling, AI, ML, data analytics, predictive analytics, R&D, market research, and big data handling. The cross-departmental interaction between data and sales and marketing makes decision-making data and tech-driven, which is an exciting prospect for tech enthusiasts.
The more initiative interns take, the more they will learn, and the possibilities for gaining knowledge and experience are unlimited.
Interns can master CRM systems to boost customer relationships and sales, explore online telephony platforms, manage schedules with cutting-edge tools, and dive into the world of artificial intelligence and machine learning projects. Data analytics and predictive analytics provide insights that drive smarter decision-making.
Interns can contribute to groundbreaking R&D projects, discover market research secrets, and become big data experts to handle massive datasets. Joining forces with sales and marketing pros to drive success with data-driven strategies will be an exciting opportunity.
This internship is perfect for those pursuing a degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or Information Systems, with strong analytical and problem-solving skills, familiarity with programming languages such as Python or R, and excellent communication and collaboration skills.
Seniority
Entry Level - A role for someone with underlying potential, good motivation and ability to learn. Typically no direct experience is required.

 Data Analysis and Reporting - Analyze data to discover and communicate insights, and offer concrete recommendations for key stakeholders to make critical decisions

Strengths

title: Internship Opportunity: Data Analyst Intern
description:
BizVision is seeking a motivated and detail-oriented Data Analyst Intern to join our team. In this role, you will work with our data team to learn how to develop a mathematical model and apply machine learning techniques.
Do you have a passion for commercial business data? If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you to join our Sydney team. The position is a hybrid role, which will allow you to learn both remotely and on-site.
About You:
The ideal candidate for this position is a self-starter with a strong work ethic and a desire to learn. You should be comfortable working independently and as part of a team, and have excellent communication and interpersonal skills. You should also have a strong interest in:

 Reviewing academic literature.
 Working on mathematical models.
 Optimisation and machine learning techniques.

Requirements:

 Advanced degree in a relevant field, such as Mathematics, Statistics, or Computer Science.
 Extensive experience with Matlab or Python for modeling and data analysis.
 knowledge of machine learning techniques, including supervised and unsupervised learning, deep learning, and reinforcement learning.
 Familiarity with common machine learning libraries, such as scikit-learn, TensorFlow, and PyTorch.
 Experience with data visualization and interpretation of results.
 Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
 Attention to detail and ability to work independently.
 Excellent communication skills to clearly explain complex concepts to others.

This is a vocational placement internship position, but we are happy to work with your institution to provide credit or other forms of recognition for your work. For successful candidates, there is the opportunity to move into a part-time/full-time data analyst position within 6 months. If you are interested in this opportunity, please submit your resume and a brief cover letter outlining your interest in the position. We look forward to hearing from you!
About Us:
BizVision is a small business buying consultancy dedicated to helping entrepreneurs and small business owners achieve their goals. Our team of experts has years of experience in business valuation, financial analysis, and deal structuring, lease negotiations, franchise valuations, and we are committed to providing personalised, client-focused service to each and every one of our clients. At BizVision, we believe that small business buyers are under-represented, and we are proud to support our clients and small business owners in their business acquisition journey helping our economy, and boosting employment in different regions.
As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we respect and seek to empower each individual and support the diverse cultures, perspectives, skills, and experiences within our workforce.
At BizVision, all employees are encouraged to be themselves and to bring their whole selves to work every day. We encourage applications from Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander people, people living with disability, culturally and linguistically diverse people, and people of the LGBTQ+ community, including transgender, gender diverse, and intersex people.
To find out more about this role you can email the hiring manager Nick Shaygan via info@bizvision.com.au.

title: Data Analyst - Work from Home (AUS or NZ)
description:
Full Time - Working from home or Hybrid role - your choice! 
  Gain experience working for an industry leading global company! 
  MUST be located in Australia or New Zealand to support business in this time zone. 
 
 THE ROLE
  This position will play a significant part in generating workforce reports and identifying people data trends for our managers and key stakeholders. In this role, you will be responsible for preparing reports by collecting, analysing, and summarising information. Use statistical analysis to identify patterns, correlations, and actionable results. To excel in this role, you will need experience in generating, analysing and presenting data.
  KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
  
  Partner with Key Stakeholders to understand and define their data and reporting needs. 
  Prepare reports by collecting, analysing, and summarising information. 
  Use statistical analysis to identify patterns, correlations, and actionable results. 
  Review data security requirements and identify any data security concerns or data anomalies. 
  Support and assist in the maintenance of RI data. 
 
 To be creative and curious about new technologies, embrace digital tools and look for new innovative ways of doing things.
  EXPERIENCE AND SKILLS
  
  Experience in generating and manipulating data to generate appropriate reports or outputs for senior management and teams in the business. 
  Moderate experience in data analysis, data cleansing and data reporting. 
  Understanding of data security, data quality and data integrity. 
  Experience with Microsoft Office / Google G Suite applications. 
  Experience in PowerBi or equivalent would be advantageous. 
  Sound problem solving skills to identify data anomalies. 
  Proven high level of organisation, prioritisation, and time management skills. 
  A good communicator who simplifies complex data, engages proactively with stakeholders and builds rapport at all levels. 
 
 BENEFITS
  
  Being a global company there are multiple pathways for career progressions. 
  Employee Rewards programs & Employee discount programs. 
  Flexible Working and a strong work life balance culture 
  Employee Assistance Program (EAP) 
  Discounted Pest Services 
  Employee Referral Program – Find a successful candidate and receive cash bonus*. 
 
 ABOUT US
  We’re a local company with an international reach across 90 countries and over 56,000 employees. Rentokil Initial is committed to be a world-class Employer of Choice. We aim to attract, recruit, and retain the best people from the widest possible pool of talent. Our customers range from the local supermarket and restaurant to large-scale industrial plants and food production companies. This is a fast-growing company and over the last five years we have expanded significantly. Our growth story continues with market-leading innovations, the latest digital tools and great training for colleagues.
  OUR VALUES
  Our values are Service, Relationships, Teamwork and Responsibility. These are at the heart of our business. Grounded, down-to-earth values, just like the people who wear our uniforms across the world. You get to build relationships with your customers and colleagues - most are with us for years, so you get to know them; and they get to know you.
  The successful candidate must be able to pass a Pre-employment medical, drug & alcohol screen as well as background checks.
  If the above role sounds like a good fit for you, please click the apply button below!

title: Australian Rules Football Data Collector (Analyst)
description:
Are you a sports fanatic with a passion for Australian Rules Football? We have the perfect opportunity for you! As an Australian Rules Football Data Collector (analyst), you will have the chance to immerse yourself in the world of sports performance analysis while working from the comfort of your own home. In this role, you will be responsible for accurately collecting and inputting data from state-level Australian Rules Football games and other relevant sources. As a member of our team, you will also have access to exclusive perks such as training in the use of industry-leading sports performance software, the opportunity to network with industry professionals, and the chance to make a meaningful contribution to coaching practices at state-level Australian Rules Football. The best part? You will have the flexibility to work around your schedule and commitments. Most work will need to be completed by 4pm Sunday of a weekend but how you structure your time will be up to you. All you need is a serviceable laptop/computer.
Key Responsibilities:

 Review Australian Rules Football games and record statistics and other relevant data using iSports' Video Analyser software
 Gather data from online sources such as team websites and sports news outlets
 Complete data collection in a timely and accurate manner (ie by 4pm Sunday)
 Perform quality checks to ensure accuracy
 Assist with the creation of reports and analysis based on the collected data

Requirements:

 Strong attention to detail and ability to work accurately under tight deadlines
 Excellent organisational skills and ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously
 Open and honest communication skills
 Excellent capacity to learn new software
 Previous experience in data entry or sports performance analysis a plus (but not required)
 Passion for Australian Rules Football and strong knowledge of the sport and its rules and statistics

We offer a competitive rate per game and the opportunity to work around your schedule. If you are a self-starter with a strong work ethic and a love for Australian Rules Football, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity.
Application Question(s):

 Have you played or do you regularly watch Australian Rules Football?
 Do you have an ABN?
 Do you have your own laptop?
 Do you have a strong understanding of the rules of Australian Rules Football and the statistics that are captured in a game?

Job Types: Subcontract, Casual, Freelance
Salary: $32.00 – $42.00 per hour
Benefits:

 Work from home

Schedule:

 Shift work

Work Authorisation:

 Australia (Preferred)

Work Location: Remote
Expected Start Date: 15/04/2023Shift work
